chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install

result.execSummary:
The defendant Tony Flores was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Tony Flores is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Tony Flores was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Tony Flores was found guilty of Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Tony Flores was found guilty of Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Tony Flores was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal) [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment. 
**  Pay fine of $     and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
** Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
**Pay DNA surcharge (unless previously provided).
  Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  No contact with known felons & maintain stable residence.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Carmen Lassiter.  Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments made.  
Count 1 - DE is sentenced to 6 years in the WSP forthwith; 3 years Initial Confinement followed by 3 years Extended Supervision.  Credit for 182 days served.  DE is eligible for CIP & SAP.  DE's driving privileges are revoked for 36 months.  Alcohol Assessment & Ignition Interlock ordered.  Fined $1600 plus costs and $140 prosecution costs ordered, which are to be paid during supervision.  See conditions.
Counts 2, 4 & 5 -   Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 2 years with conditions Consecutive to Count 1.  See conditions.
Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Lassiter.  Clerk: PT
Atty Lassiter requests a new date as she recently received the PSI and needs to go over the PSI with DE; no objection by the State.  Sentencing on 4/15/15 at 11:30 AM.
Executed search warrant filed on 10-16-14 transfered from 14GF4148X  KSD 14-152924

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Carmen Lassiter.  Clerk: PT
Case is resolved.  Counts 1, 2, 4 and 5 - Deft. pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Counts 3 & 6 - Dismissed by the State. PSI ordered for Sentencing on 3/26/15 at 10:00 AM.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Carmen Lassiter. Clerk: PT
Atty Lassiter states DE is trying to get into the Living Free Program and requests one more adjournment; no objection by the State.  FPT adj. to 1/23/15 at 9:30 AM.
Final pre-trial on December 17, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Due to a continued jury trial on 11/5/14; FPT rescheduled to 12/17/14 at 9:30 AM per confirmation with Atty Lassiter.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: of Judge Schroeder filed by Atty. Lassiter. Tab pulled for Judge Kerkman.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Carmen Lassiter. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Request for substitution of Judge Schroeder filed by Atty. Lassiter. Tab pulled for Judge Kerkman. Bound over to Br. 8. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 11-5-14 @ 9:30am. Bond continued.

147pm
  Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Carmen Lassiter.  Clerk LE.  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set on 10/21/14 @ 945am.  $10,000  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).

*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *Not to drive w/o VALID Driver's License or without ignition interlock.    If released, Report to WCS by 11:00 the next business day; Submit to random UA's upon request.  Comply w/ all program requirements & provide all required information.
